snippet: The group’s claim of responsibility of the massacre coincided with news of a religious decree from Syria’s grand mufti suggesting Syria needs more recruits and that it was a call to jihad.
abstract: Islamic State of Iraq, Sunni militant jihadist group in Iraq, claims responsibility for killing dozens of Syrian soldiers who had sought temporary safety on Iraqi side of border, boasting about massacre in Internet posting; message from groups reflects hardened sectarian animus spreading from Syrian conflict.

byline.original: By HANIA MOURTADA and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Tim Arango and Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: The group’s claim of responsibility of the massacre coincided with news of a religious decree from Syria’s grand mufti suggesting Syria needs more recruits and that it was a call to jihad.

headline.seo: Islamic State of Iraq Says It Killed Syrian Soldiers
headline.main: Qaeda Group in Iraq Says It Killed Syrian Soldiers
headline.print_headline: Qaeda Group in Iraq Says It Killed Syrian Soldiers
